properties.name: 1st Baptist Church of Krotz Springs
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunI have one pleasant memory of this church...my wedding. There were so many unpleasant ones as I hated Vacation Bible School because I felt Miss Rexie was so mean to me....she probably wasn\'t but I was a brat as a kid, a now deceased deacon who should have been arrested for what he attempted to do to me but the police were never notified, and the Miss Rexie telling my dad that he was in her pew. That one might be a good memory because my dad asked her if it had her name on it. Guess what....they now have gold name tags on pews in that church. *rolling my eyes*

properties.name: American Bank
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThis wasn\'t here when I lived here. But it is nice that my mom has a bank right here in town and everybody knows her and takes care of her with that personal touch you only get in small towns.

properties.name: Catholic Church Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThis is where my daddy is buried. I miss him so much.

properties.name: Church field
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunWhen I grew up this was an empty field across the street from my house and beside it was the Senneville Hall where they held dances and wedding receptions. My dad HATED it because the music went on into the early hours of the morning and was VERY loud. After years of my dad complaining, the church (who owned the hall) moved it beside the church. My parents used to make a huge cooler of ice water and we would play softball in this field...me and the other kids my age in town. It was so much fun!! My nephew was riding a homemade gocart in this field, reached back to pull the choke and found out real quick that there was no chain guard....ground up two fingers and severed one...which they reattached and he wishes now they hadn\'t. So many memories in this field.

properties.name: Dreyfus Store
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunWhen I was growing up Dreyfus Store was in the same strip as the post office. It is was a one stop shop and we even bought our PE uniforms for Krotz Springs Elementary here. My parents thought it was expensive so we really only went here to buy PE uniforms.

properties.name: Hill Park
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThis was the only park in town when I was growing up (Well until my teen years, which is when Nall Park was built.) It has tennis courts, playground equipment, and a baseball field.

properties.name: Jim's Grocery
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThe only grocery store still operating in Krotz Springs right now. It is directly across from the elementary school and next door to one of the two barbers in town so it was THE place to go. It is still old school. My mom still has a charge account there. She charges her groceries and when she gets her Social Security check at the beginning of the month, she pays off her account.

properties.name: Krotz Springs Elementary
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunOh how I LOVED this school. So many good memories. I had great teachers that prepared me well for the real world. Our principal, Mr. Skrantz, was tough but fair. This Elementary School holds so many memories for me. Not only did I go from K5 through 8th grade here but it was my first job. When I was 12 I got a job through the JTPA working to clean up the school and campus to get it ready for the following school year. Mr. Skrantz worked us hard but it was worth it. I felt such a feeling of accomplishment every summer working there. Those were the good old days!

properties.name: Krotz Springs Town Hall
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThis is our town hall. It is where the police department was, where you paid your water bill and phone bill, where you voted, where you could attend town meetings, etc.

properties.name: Little Capital
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThere once was a little restaurant named the Little Capital Restaurant that was right here where I put this marker. One night, when I was in high school, we heard a LOUD BOOOOOOM! It shook our house so violently that pictures fell off the wall and I nearly fell out of bed. Little Capital Restaurant had blown up...actually it blew out. The pieces flew across the highway and behind the building instead of up. Lots of rumors went around that it was an explosive device that did it because gas explosions blow up not out. I don\'t know and I don\'t care. But it is a memory that will last the residents a lifetime. Where were you when Little Capital blew up?

properties.name: Make out point
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunWhen I was growing up, this is where everyone went to park. It was under the railroad bridge and surrounded by trees so nobody could see you unless they came on that road. Cops seemed to ignore it at the time. Don\'t know about now but back then everyone knew if you wanted some alone time, you went under the railroad bridge.

properties.name: Nall Park
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunWhen I grew up, this was an ugly old abandoned house. Thanks to the wonderful mayor and aldermen, the house has been torn down and the property transformed into a very nice park, with cement walking track, playground equipment, cement parking lot that leads to an open sided covered pavillion that has a kitchen and bathrooms for get togethers, a tennis court, and softball field. It also has a few covered places to barbeque as well. It is beautiful. I lived right down the street from this...not even a quarter of a mile and was able to watch the fireworks for the 4th of July celebration and Atchafalaya Fun Fest.

properties.name: Nall's store
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunI don\'t know where the building is on this map but in real life the building for Nall\'s store is still there. It was my favorite store to go to because they were so nice in there and always had good candy with good prices and if we were a few cents short, Mr. Nall would say "let her have it." He was a nice man.

properties.name: Post Office
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunThis is where they built the post office after it moved from beside Dreyfus\' store. It is very nice.

properties.name: Susie's home cookin
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunMy first job (besides JTPA) was at Susie\'s Home Cookin. It a little orangish pink building and I learned alot there. A friend of our family, Tammy, bought it and called it Settler\'s Restaurant. I don\'t know why the building isn\'t on this map but it is right here where the mark is...you can see the driveway cut out. Anyway, if you want delicious food at reasonable prices, you can\'t beat Settler\'s. I look forward to eating there when I go home for a visit.

properties.name: The first house we lived in
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunMy parents rented a tiny little house right behind my dad\'s mechanic shop when we first moved to Krotz Springs. It is still there. Cute little house.

properties.name: The horseshoe
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunIf you scroll down, you will see these two streets (Gabriel and Louise) make a horseshoe. When I was growing up, the cool kids lived in the horseshoe. I begged my mom to move on the horseshoe. Of course she said no. But her brother lived (actually still does live) on the horseshoe. It is funny how kids create these labels in their head!

properties.name: The projects
properties.description: Posted by SassiecajunAll these white buildings are the projects. They are actually brick with a white roof. It isn\'t like ghettos in big cities. The town has an ordinance that they strictly enforce about you junking up your yard. So this may not be where you want to live but at least it isn\'t nasty like most low cost housing.

properties.name: Where my dad's mechanic shop used to be
properties.description: Posted by Sassiecajun When we first moved to Krotz Springs, my dad opened Raymond\'s Auto Repair Shop right next to the Burger Hut. He was there 7 years before he was diagnosed with severe heart disease and told not to work anymore. But in those 7 years, my dad built a reputation in that town of being honest and a great mechanic. A few in town too advantage of him by not paying the bill after he worked on their car. He trusted that they would make notes on the bill, as they promised. These people took advantage of my dad\'s trusting spirit. What goes around comes around. But I loved going there to visit. I used to walk next door to the Burger Hut, which was owned by the Solar family. It was such a cool place. The tables were white with gold sparkles. I thought they were beautiful. The burgers were HUGE and only . (Am I telling my age or what?) Mr. and Mrs. Solar were such wonderful people....sooo nice to me.
